awards: Dean's List: Fall 2016, Spring 2017, Fall + Spring 2018, Spring 2019

experience.title: Protein Engineer 2
highlights: Led an R&D program to develop a biosensor and ultra-high-throughput in-vivo screen for improving protein biophysical characteristics (>$200K budget, cross-company team).
Most junior employee to lead a program among +250 programs at the time.
Designed and implemented FACS experiments to evaluate protein variant libraries for biophysical characteristics in both bacterial and yeast systems.
Executed engineering campaigns delivering 14 improved proteins across 8 projects.
Designed and cloned multiple high-quality variant libraries of up to 8 million members.
Implemented protein design models (EvCouplings, Meta ESM, AgroScan-3D, Protein MPNN) and software (Pymol, Rosetta Design, Schrodinger Maestro).
Wrote custom scripts in Python (AWS infrastructure) to analyze large NGS datasets.
Optimized, developed, and wrote protocols across molecular biology techniques (nicking mutagenesis, golden gate cloning, yeast electroporation, qPCR, western blotting).
Co-founded the Seedling Affinity Group (professional development group for junior scientists).

experience.title: Research Associate 1
highlights: Generated custom pooled ORF, RNAi, and CRISPR knockout guide DNA libraries (up to 92,000 variants).
Optimized the cloning process for integrating nucleotide barcodes into existing CRISPR pools.
Adapted lab automation to reduce labor time for arrayed pool production.
Evaluated pool quality via molecular analysis & next-generation sequencing (created Python QC data pipeline).
Developed troubleshooting strategies for libraries that failed QC using Python scripts.
Managed, distributed, and tracked reagents with a Laboratory Information Management System.
Volunteered night shifts for clinical COVID-19 testing during the pandemic.

experience.title: Process Biochemistry Intern
highlights: Designed and executed a continuous membrane-only purification scheme for Aducanumab (2% of the time of existing platform purification).
Worked with process development to design purification schemes for biologics.
Evaluated alternative technologies to replace Protein A packed bed chromatography.

experience.title: Undergraduate Researcher
highlights: Collected and processed soil and leaf samples from 50+ New England sites to discover lactobacillus sources in the cabbage biome.
Extracted and sequenced 16s rRNA of farm soil and leaf bacterial isolates to determine phenology.
Compared relative growth rates of cabbage phyllosphere microbes.
Created a system for selective amplification of rare lactobacillus populations.
Co-authored two publications on lactic acid bacteria establishment and experimental methods.

experience.title: Chromatography Research Intern
highlights: Increased manufacturing yields from 53% to 79% by designing a new packing procedure for agarose and cellulose chromatography resins.
Performed packing studies to reduce failure risk in OPUS HPLC column manufacturing.
Tested agarose resins for improved structural properties.
